summary: This document is an email chain from April 2021 among U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) personnel and contractors regarding the preparation of a supplemental discovery production in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The emails discuss stamping documents, converting video/audio files, and drafting a cover letter responding to defense counsel Everdell.

persons.name: Everdell
persons.context: Mentioned as the recipient of a response in a cover letter being drafted by the prosecution team. Likely represents Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: M. is preparing a prosecution cover letter in response to a recent letter from defense attorney Everdell.
They are collaborating on the Maxwell discovery production, with S. providing instructions and M. handling revisions and coordination.

events.title: Discovery Production Preparation
events.description: The prosecution team finalizes a supplemental discovery production for the Maxwell case, involving stamping documents, converting PBPD surveillance video and Amex production files, and drafting a cover letter.

events.title: Planning Supplemental Discovery
events.description: The prosecution informs the team of plans to make a supplemental discovery production in a few weeks, after a superseding event, and sends advance materials including problematic audio files.

keyFacts: The prosecution was preparing a supplemental discovery production in the Ghislaine Maxwell case in April 2021.
The production included PBPD (Palm Beach Police Department) surveillance video footage and American Express (Amex) records that required conversion to usable formats.
The correspondence indicates the prosecution was drafting a cover letter to respond to a recent communication from Maxwell's defense attorney, Everdell.
The emails highlight the logistical efforts (stamping, file conversion) undertaken by US Attorney's Office contractors to manage voluminous discovery.
